intro: Paratropia elata, commonly known as the slender palaquio, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow to greenish in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
